intro: Palicourea mexicana, commonly known as Mexican palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Palicourea mexicana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
